discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Contour is an ingress controller for Kubernetes that supports dynamic configuration updates and multi-team ingress delegation. It provides the control plane for the Envoy edge and service proxy.

https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/vmware-tanzu/standalone-components/tanzu-application-platform/1-8/tap/contour-about.html

choices.D: Contour provides load balancing for ingress traffic.
choices.B: Contour provides encryption services for pod to pod network traffic.
choices.A: Contour provides egress management at the application layer.
choices.C: Contour provides ingress management at the application layer.

questions.question_text: What role does Contour play in a Tanzu for Kubernetes Architecture?
What is a valid method to increase the size of worker nodes in VMware Tanzu Kubernetes Grid cluster?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Size of node is vertical, number of node is Horizontally

Selected Answer: C
Scallion in TKG achieved by adding more nodes to cluster, not increasing resources for current nodes (Vertical scale)

questions.question_text:
An administrator has a VMware Tanzu Kubernetes Grid management cluster named tanzu-mc0l which needs to be upgraded.
Which command can be used to upgrade this cluster?

discussion.content:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Tanzu-Kubernetes-Grid/2.5/tkg-deploy-mc/mgmt-upgrade-index.html
After you have installed the new versions of the components, you use the tanzu mc upgrade and tanzu cluster upgrade CLI commands to upgrade management clusters and workload clusters.

questions.question_text: Which three policies can be configured in VMware Tanzu Mission Control? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BEF
The policy types available in Tanzu Mission Control include the following:
access policy
image registry policy
network policy
quota policy
security policy
custom policy
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Tanzu-Mission-Control/services/tanzumc-concepts/GUID-847414C9-EF54-44E5-BA62-C4895160CE1D.html

questions.question_text: What is the difference between admin and edit permissions in access control policies for objects in VMware Tanzu Mission Control?

choices.B: Admin permission allows for the object to be moved between resource object hierarchies, while edit does not.
choices.C: Edit permission allows access to view, create, and delete, as well as edit access policy, while admin only allows access to view, create, and delete.
choices.A: There is no difference between admin and edit permissions.
choices.D: Admin permission allows access to view, create, and delete, as well as edit access policy, while edit only allows access to view, create, and delete.
